definition:
In graph theory, a *loop* is an edge which joins a vertex to itself,
rather than to some other vertex. By definition, a graph cannot contain
a loop; a pseudograph, however, may contain both multiple edges and
multiple loops. Note that by some definitions, a multigraph may contain
multiple edges and no loops, while other texts define a multigraph as a
graph allowing multiple edges and multiple loops.

In algebra, a *loop* is a quasigroup which contains an identity element.
